body_html:
@nadavbh12 maybe the HDD that is in your current machine is abnormally slow?
You could perform some disk read tests and compare the reading time on both machines. The numbers you sent in your first message clearly indicates that the data loading time is the issue. Maybe the disk was being used at the same time?
body_text:
@nadavbh12 maybe the HDD that is in your current machine is abnormally slow?
You could perform some disk read tests and compare the reading time on both machines. The numbers you sent in your first message clearly indicates that the data loading time is the issue. Maybe the disk was being used at the same time?
body:
@nadavbh12 maybe the HDD that is in your current machine is abnormally slow?
You could perform [some disk read tests](http://askubuntu.com/questions/87035/how-to-check-hard-disk-performance) and compare the reading time on both machines. The numbers you sent in your first message clearly indicates that the data loading time is the issue. Maybe the disk was being used at the same time?
